Contractions are mostly either accusative or dative case. The first part is a preposition and the second part an article. For example "durchs" is formed from "durch" + "das" and would be translated with "trough" or "trough the" "durchs Wasser" means "through the water" or "trough water" depending on the context. Then you have different contractions depending on the dialect e.g. "son" = "so/solch ein" in the North (Hamburg, Bremen and such) or "hammer" = "haben wir" in the Rhine area (except maybe Cologne). Most of these get clearer through the context but there are some where even I have to ask the person what the fuck it means, so don't be afraid to ask if they are using slang/dialect.
I don't think there are real rules to when which syllable can be dropped and even if there are nobody ever told me them. For the most part the words have gone into our speech and are now part of the language. I'm not even sure if any teacher in Germany would mark it as an error if you write "Ich hab" instead of "Ich hab'".

WRITING.TITLE: I envy fictional characters
WRITING.TEXT:
The title is pretty much tl;dr, so if you don't want to read unsorted rambling with most likely many errors in phrasing and stuff then skip ahead.
I envy characters out of books, mangas, animes or short stories I read/watch. I don't mean I envy them for having some special kind of power or being special in some way. I mean sure sometimes I think it would be nice to have one of thoose, but in general I envy them because they are able to form meaningful interhuman relationships.
I envy them for having friends who are there for them (and they are there for their friends) when need be, friends who put up with the shit they do and maybe even like them even more because of it. I envy them for the people in their lives with whom they seem to be able to share happy and sad moments, but each knows that due to this sharing even the sad moments are good moments, because they didn't need to go trough them alone. I also envy them for finding love that seems to be able to bridge over all the problems thrown at them. Love that seems to be in it's truest form. A love that is more than just a romantical feeling but also a feeling for a friend.
I know this stuff is idealized, but still I image how it would be if I were this character. I immerse so deep into them that even when I lay in bed trying to sleep I sometimes just think how awesome it would be to wake up and be that character. Even when the story ends I tend to think about how it goes on for them. How they grow old see their children and the children of their friends grow and maybe even see the children raise the grandchildren. I try to imagine how happy they can feel when their life ends.
I tried many times to make friendships like that happen. I tried all I could, but in the end it didn't work out. I don't really have any close friends and to be hones never really had. Sure I had "friends" in school but most of them I only saw in school and sometimes afterwards. Sure I had people I spend a bit of my free time with, but most of them live far away and are not really close. I don't know when or why, but for me it always feels like at somepoint in all my interhuman relationships there comes the point where I withdraw a bit. I hate myself for it but I can't do anything against it. I always only show anybody some side of me never all.
Well excuse my rambling and any error I made while writing, beside that it's really hard for me to express such stuff English is not my first language so I always have to think twice about what to write. Nontheless thank you for reading and good day/night sir/madam

WRITING.TITLE: I'm relapsing and I'm relapsing oh did I say I'm relapsing?
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm currently relapsing on different things in my life I had problems with at some stages in the past. There are three big things I'm relapsing on and I try to make as much sense of it as I can.
First there is my "gaming addiction", it's not really an addiction to gaming but an addiction to the social level of multiplayer games, for the most part of MMORPGs. There was a time in my life when I was 13-15 where I played a lot of Everquest 2. I was in a small guild and they were my only social contactes out of school and family. I had fun with them and we spent much time together. In the end to much time because my marks started to get worse and worse. I stayed up all night to do stuff and yeah I also kind of fell in love with one girl in the group. However at one point I got out of the game long enough to get "free" of it. Sadly I lost contact with all of my friends but shit happens. The same happened again a few years back now. I was living alone and was studying. I had a bit of free time and whenever I had free time I would play Star Wars: The Old Republic. I got to know two guys there and we were kind of a close guild. Through these guys I also started play Battlefield 3 and met a few more people. People I now consider maybe my best friends, even through I rarely see them, because they live in Sweden and I'm in Germany. But back to my addiction. I was ball deep into both games and played a freaking lot, but mostly with the group of friends. I neglected university and other things, just so that I could play. Well fast forward to now, I los my job a few months back and I feel myself dragged more and more into the allure of MMOs. I'm kind of avoiding most multiplayer games just so that I don't go into them the same way I did before and neglect my search for a job. But I'm feeling that I will soon give in.
The second thing I relapsed on is related to my depression. I was in therapy, but because of stupid reasons I quit it and now I'm relapsing old bad behaviours I often did before. I'm revisiting all the bad things I did in the last 24 years (so all my life) and I mean all I can remember. The one time I nearly broke the foot of a good female friend of mine and stuff like that. I revisited all of them and force myself to see all the mistakes and errors I made. I don't eat as much anymore, because the food is to precious to be given to someone like me. I'm holding my hand into open flames just to feel the pain, I cut myself with a knife or scissors. And I'm thinking about ending it all.
The last thing is kind of related to the first thing. I always go back to all the messages my last gf I and texted each other on facebook. I go back to her profile and see her picture and feel the pain. I read her last response to my last message (which said that I couldn't be a friend of her, because my feelings for her where still there) and am sad how distant her answer was. I'm reading the happy messages we shared and just want this time back, but then I remember I won't get it back and it's all my fault. And then I go back to the second relapse...
I don't know how much, if any, sense this all makes for you guys out there reading this. I don't even know if relapse is the right word (English is not my first language) and I don't know what I expect from this, but I just have to get it off and I don't have anyone I could talk to about this.

I think the most important thing in Germany is that we have a fomal and informal language. That means in business context always use the formal language and only switch if the other person offers you to switch it. Assuming you are lower in hierarchy and/or younger, if you are higher and/or older it's up to you to offer the informal language.
There are some buisness contexts where it's okay to use the informal language right away. These are for example in a bar/pub/disco or a fast food restaurant like McDonalds and sometimes the taxi.
In private context it all depends on the person you are dealing with. Most Germans are okay with the informal language, but if you are not sure, then always choose the formal language.
